title: Sucket Fork, ca. 1840–45
markings: On cap near stem; Austrian mark of 19th c. Tardy, SILVER, p.74
inscribed: Engraving on cap mark cuts through mark, probably 19th century piece.
provenance: Rothschild Collection/ Blumka Gallery, New York/ Robert L. Metzenberg
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Long two tined fork, tines cast with stem as stylized crustacean. Twisted stem. Foliate knop at juncture with handle. Octagonal wood handle, silver cap and terminal cap. Finial cast as seated dog on a battlement.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Sucket Fork, ca. 1840–45.
ca. 1840–45. Silver, wood. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-33.
